stare.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored
stare.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She sat there staring into space (=looking for a long time at nothing).
She stared at me in disbelief.
stare.translation[0].note_box[0].section: She stared hard at him for a moment.
Harry stared fixedly out of the window.
Lucy stared blankly at the teacher.
She sat down on the bed and stared unseeingly at the wall.
Mum was staring vacantly at the fire.
He was staring moodily into his glass.
Hilary stared in disbelief at the kitchen clock.
Jo's always lying on the sofa staring into space.
stare.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: when you look at something or someone for a long time in a steady way
stare.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She gave him a long hard stare.
She laughed, ignoring the stares of everyone around her.
His pleas were met by a blank stare (=a stare with no expression, understanding, or interest).
